extendedIngredients.name: graham cracker crust
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 9” graham cracker crust (baked or no-bake, from scratch or the grocery store)
metaInformation: (baked or no-bake, from scratch or the grocery store)

extendedIngredients.name: marshmallows
extendedIngredients.originalString: About 20 large marshmallows (or more if you want)

recipes.title: Chocolate Ganache S’mores Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Pie works really well with Lambrusco Dolce, Late Harvest Riesling, and Vin Santo. These wines are all sweet, which is important since wine should usually be sweeter than the food you're pairing with it. You could try Snake River Late Harvest Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Snake River Late Harvest Riesling
productMatches.description: Made from the grapes left to hang on the vine in our estate Arena Valley Vineyard, Late Harvest Riesling is our original dessert wine. Our 2011 has a limeade nose with a hint of minerals and a honey finish. Enjoy this wine with fruit based desserts or as a refreshing aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Place chocolate chips and heavy whipping cream in a medium bowl. Heat in the microwave for 45 seconds, then whisk. If the chocolate doesn’t melt into the heavy cream, heat an additional 15-30 seconds, whisking every 15. Whisk until mixture is smooth. Pour ganache into prepared crust. Cover and chill until set, at least 2 hours. Right before serving top with large marshmallows. Broil or use a hand torch to toast the marshmallows. Best served right after topping with the marshmallows.

steps.step: Place chocolate chips and heavy whipping cream in a medium bowl.
Heat in the microwave for 45 seconds, then whisk. If the chocolate doesn’t melt into the heavy cream, heat an additional 15-30 seconds, whisking every 15.

Pour ganache into prepared crust. Cover and chill until set, at least 2 hours. Right before serving top with large marshmallows. Broil or use a hand torch to toast the marshmallows. Best served right after topping with the marshmallows.
